definition: to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to grow/to plant/to insert/to force on sb/to fall head first

sentences.english: The gun the prosecutors used must have been a plant.
sentences.chinese: 起訴方用來作證的那支槍肯定是栽贓的。

sentences.english: For years, Soviet propaganda blamed the massacre on Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 多年來，蘇聯的宣傳機構一直栽贓納粹德國。

sentences.english: This is no doubt meant to slander and defile money.
sentences.chinese: 這無疑是對金錢的污衊與栽贓。

sentences.english: He tried to plant the stolen money on the boy .
sentences.chinese: 他企圖把偷來的錢栽贓到這個小男孩身上。

sentences.english: The thief had planned to plant the stolen watch on a fellow lodger.
sentences.chinese: 小偷打算把偷來的手錶栽贓給同住的房客手上。

definition: to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to hog/to keep everything for oneself
to be devoid of all humanity/inhuman/bestial
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
